metadata.description: cVIGIL complaint guidance dataset — process steps, violation types, escalation paths, and helpline references.

cvigil_overview.full_name: Citizen Vigilance Against Model Code of Conduct Violations
cvigil_overview.purpose: Enables citizens to report Model Code of Conduct (MCC) violations and electoral malpractice in real time using a mobile app.
cvigil_overview.active_period: From date of election notification (Model Code of Conduct comes into force) until counting day.

app_platforms.ios: Available on Apple App Store — search 'cVIGIL ECI'

anonymous_complaint.limitations: Anonymous complaints are accepted but follow-up or status tracking requires a registered account.

complaint_process.title: How to File a cVIGIL Complaint — Step by Step

steps.details: Location is auto-detected via GPS. Citizen captures photo or video evidence of the violation (max 2 minutes video).
Select the type of MCC violation from the list, add a brief description if needed, and submit. A unique Complaint ID is generated immediately.
DCR receives the geotagged complaint in real time and assigns the nearest available Flying Squad or surveillance team.
Field team navigates to the GPS-tagged location. They must reach within the defined window and submit field report with action taken.
Final decision is made by the Returning Officer or designated decider. Complaint is marked as resolved or escalated.
Citizen can track the status of their complaint using the Complaint ID on the cVIGIL app or portal.

complaint_process.note: The 100-minute SLA is a target — not a guarantee. Complex violations may take longer.

violation_types.description: Types of MCC violations that can be reported via cVIGIL

categories.name: Illegal hoardings / banners / posters
categories.description: Unauthorized campaign materials, banners, or posters displayed in violation of MCC guidelines.

categories.name: Cash distribution
categories.description: Distribution of cash, gifts, or valuables to induce voters.

categories.name: Liquor distribution
categories.description: Illegal distribution of alcohol to voters before or during election period.

categories.name: Paid news
categories.description: News or media content that is paid political advertisement presented as genuine news.

categories.name: Use of government vehicles / resources
categories.description: Misuse of government vehicles, infrastructure, or staff for campaign activities.

categories.name: Voter intimidation / booth intimidation
categories.description: Threatening, coercing, or intimidating voters at booths or in their homes.

categories.name: Firearms / weapons display
categories.description: Unlawful display or use of firearms and weapons to influence voters.

categories.name: Post-poll period campaigning
categories.description: Campaigning activities after the prescribed silence period begins (48 hours before polling).

categories.name: Defacement of public property
categories.description: Writing on walls, painting, or defacing public or private property for campaign purposes.

categories.name: Carrying arms near polling area
categories.description: Carrying weapons in or near a polling station (prohibited under Section 144 CrPC during elections).

categories.name: Other MCC violation
categories.description: Any other violation of the Model Code of Conduct not categorized above.

options.note: Call to register complaint verbally. Complaint will be logged by the call centre.

options.description: Citizen can visit the office of the Returning Officer (RO) of their constituency and submit a written complaint.
options.where_to_find: Contact CEO Kerala website (https://www.ceo.kerala.gov.in) for Kottayam RO contact details.

options.description: Complaints may also be submitted to the District Election Officer, Kottayam.
options.address_note: DEO office is typically at the District Collectorate, Kottayam.

options.description: Permission and complaint portal for candidates and political parties.

important_notes: cVIGIL is active ONLY after the Model Code of Conduct (MCC) comes into effect — i.e., from election notification date.
Do not submit false or frivolous complaints. Action may be taken against misuse.
Video evidence gives the fastest response. Photo is also accepted.
GPS location is mandatory for complaints — location spoofing invalidates the complaint.
Vaakku does not simulate or file complaints. It only provides guidance and redirects to official channels.

cannot_do: File a complaint on behalf of the user
